jobs.title: data engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
turbopuffer is looking for someone to own our customer data journey & build systems that drive revenue growth, profitability & customer success, all while having an extreme sense of ownership.

what you'll do:

  • Build an end-to-end customer analytics pipeline from prospect to expansion

  • Own metrics reporting and actionable intelligence dissemination

  • Develop predictive usage forecasting models for capacity planning

  • Build simulation platform for strategic pricing modelling

  • Develop margin profiling systems, tracking per-customer & workload unit economics

  • Create cloud cost optimization frameworks with customer cost attribution

  • Build competitive pricing intelligence models

must have:

  • data background - you have a love for all things data

  • Expert SQL & Python

  • Expert in data pipelines

nice to have:

  • vector search or full-text search background

  • experience with the major cloud platforms

values we live by:

  • overstep > understep

  • correctness > simplicity > performance

  • customer traces > first principles > hunches

  • show > tell

jobs.title: account executive
jobs.descriptionHtml:
turbopuffer needs someone who can close deals with engineers. Our customers are technical teams already building in a fast market. Your job is help our customers win.

we’re open to two types of people:

  • AE who actually understands what they’re selling

  • technical person ready to carry a quota

what you’ll do

  • live in customer slack channels, helping to solve problems, drive deals forward

  • close inbound deals

  • manage POCs and work closely with solutions engineers

  • answer questions honestly, say no when it’s not a fit

  • navigate and improve internal systems

must-haves

  • technical – you can read API docs without crying

  • systematic – you track your pipeline and follow through

  • human – you don’t lie to customers

  • urgent – you move fast because our customers do

  • independent – you get things done without being explicitly told

  • typist - you can write well and can explain complex ideas simply

  • scientist - be open to experimentation and learn from your failures

nice to have

  • you’ve sold to developers before and know why they hate salespeople

  • experience with databases, search, or infra software

  • experience with GTM automation tools like Clay, n8n etc.

  • comfort with python/javascript, linux, or cloud platforms

values we live by:

  • overstep > understep

  • correctness > simplicity > performance

  • customer traces > first principles > hunches

  • show > tell

jobs.title: solutions engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
turbopuffer is looking for someone to be a technical champion for our customers - demos, POCs, firefighting, whatever it takes to make them successful.

what you'll do:

  • build concrete demos and POCs instead of slides

  • jump on calls to answer the hard questions and unblock deals

  • own the technical relationship end-to-end. drive evaluations, guide implementations

  • treat customer problems as your own and don't rest until they're solved

  • live in customer slack channels, helping to solve problems and architect solutions

  • say no when we're not the right fit and always have a growth mindset

  • work closely with engineering to drive product roadmap for customers

  • update documentation whenever you see an issue or something isn’t clear

must have:

  • commercial - you sell painkillers, not vitamins

  • data background - you love looking at explain plans and optimizing schemas

  • linux - you're comfortable in terminals and reading logs

  • python or javascript/typescript - for building solutions and demos

  • typist - you can write well and can explain complex ideas simply

  • human - you build trust and know when you're in over your head

nice to have:

  • vector search or full-text search background

  • k8s and cloud platform experience

  • performance benchmarking experience

values we live by:

  • overstep > understep

  • correctness > simplicity > performance

  • customer traces > first principles > hunches

  • show > tell

jobs.title: database engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
turbopuffer is looking for database engineers who want to advance the frontier of search.

what you'll do:

  • design and implement improvements across one or more layers of our search engine (storage, indexing, querying)

  • intensive performance hacking: tracing, CPU/heap profiling, optimizing data structures, using SIMD, tuning IO pipelines, etc.

  • evolve our search primitives and APIs (full text + vector + reranking)

  • work closely with customers to win their workloads and fold learnings back into the product

  • write crisp docs

must have:

  • systems engineering

    • you've worked extensively in a systems language (Rust, C++, Java, Go, etc.)

    • you think in memory layouts, cache lines, and syscalls

    • you methodically work through problems until you've found the root cause

  • domain expertise — you're an expert in at least one of the following domains

    • search internals (e.g., inverted indexes, ANN indexes, rerankers)

    • storage engines (e.g., LSMs, WALs, MVCC, compaction, GC)

    • distributed systems (e.g., replication, leases, fault injection, simulation/chaos testing)

  • linux — you're at home in terminals, eBPF/perf, strace, gdb

  • typist — you can write well and explain complex ideas simply

  • human — you build trust and admit what you don’t know

nice to have:

  • multiple years of experience writing Rust

  • you've maintained or operated serious systems in production, at scale

  • you've made interesting contributions to the databases, IR, or systems communities (e.g., research, open source, speaking)

  • additional domain expertise in:

    • k8s and cloud infra (GKE/EKS/AKS, disks and networking, load balancers, observability)

    • security (multi-tenant systems, isolation, sandboxing)

values we live by:

  • overstep > understep

  • correctness > simplicity > performance

  • customer traces > first principles > hunches

  • show > tell

jobs.title: lead security engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
turbopuffer is seeking a security and compliance expert to take our posture to the next level.

what you’ll do

  • implement security-related features within the turbopuffer codebase and infrastructure

  • handle security operations, including threat detection and response, vulnerability and incident management, etc.

  • own and enhance our existing SOC 2 and HIPAA programs

  • communicate directly with our customers’ security teams to build trust

  • implement additional standards (e.g. ISO 27k) based on customer demand

  • grow the security team over time

must-haves

  • you’re a proficient programmer in a security-critical context

  • you're a strong communicator and can explain complex ideas clearly

  • your passion for infosec is contagious

nice to have

  • you've lead security and/or compliance in a cloud-native environment

  • you’re intimately familiar with secure practises in:

    • rust and typescript

    • k8s (GKE, EKS, AKS)

  • you’ve made interesting contributions to the security community (e.g. exploits, research, open source, speaking)

values we live by

  • overstep > understep

  • correctness > simplicity > performance

  • show > tell
